meanings.definition: Removed in thought from the immediate situation, lost in one's own mind
meanings.sent1: She looked so abstracted during the lecture, lost in her own thoughts.
meanings.sent2: The abstracted artist painted for hours, completely absorbed in his work.
meanings.sent3: The abstracted student accidentally walked into the wrong classroom, thinking deeply.
meanings.sent4: Her abstracted expression made her seem like she was in a different world.
meanings.sent5: His abstracted behavior was a clear sign that he was daydreaming.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of concentration on what is happening around one
meanings.sent1: The abstracted driver almost missed the turn because he was not paying attention.
meanings.sent2: She had an abstracted look on her face, clearly not focused on the task at hand.
meanings.sent3: The abstracted waiter brought the wrong order to the table, lost in thought.
meanings.sent4: His abstracted behavior in class led to missing important information.
meanings.sent5: The abstracted child wandered off in the store, unaware of his surroundings.

meanings.definition: Existing only in the mind; not representing actual reality
meanings.sent1: The abstracted concept of time travel fascinated the students in the science class.
meanings.sent2: The abstracted world in the novel was full of magical creatures and unreal landscapes.
meanings.sent3: In his abstracted state, he believed he could fly like a superhero.
meanings.sent4: The abstracted idea of talking animals in the story captured the children's imagination.
meanings.sent5: Her abstracted thoughts created a fantasy world where anything was possible.
